headline: Baked French Toast
description: A sweet and sumptuous baked French toast recipe which is prepared the night before and baked in the morning.

video.description: This baked French toast casserole is so tasty, and easy to assemble.
video.name: Baked French Toast

name: Baked French Toast
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 pound) loaf French bread, cut diagonally in 1 inch slices

recipeInstructions.text: Butter a 9x13 inch baking dish. Arrange the slices of bread in the bottom.
In a large bowl, beat together eggs, milk, cream, vanilla and cinnamon. Pour over bread slices, cover, and refrigerate overnight.
The next morning, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a small saucepan, combine butter, brown sugar and corn syrup; heat until bubbling.
Pour over bread and egg mixture.
Bake in preheated oven, uncovered, for 40 minutes.

review.reviewBody: only used 6 eggs, and followed reviews and flipped half way. Think if I had diced the bread it would have been even better. Turned out pretty good though, will make again.
Looks Delicious ü§§ yum üòã

I veganized it and used just egg and dairy creamer for the egg base. And I used earth balance butter and maple syrup to create the syrup to top it. We didn‚Äôt use nuts. But we did use some no dairy whip cream and it was fantastic! Also, I only used a half loaf of bread and dipped then soaked the slices and only let it marinate for about 2.5 hours before baking. I took it out a couple of times to rotate the bread to make sure it was evenly coated and soaking as well. *my son is allergic to eggs, nuts and milk but I love French Toast so we had to make it work!
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??
I did like it however i thought it had too much liquid in it and i would definitely cut back

Delicious! I used 7 eggs and only 1 cup of milk. As others suggested, I flipped the pieces of bread after a few hours. I also added some fruit when I put it in the oven to bake. I cut the bread a little too thick and the center of the pieces were not quite soaked through.
We love this recipe!!! We make it every Christmas morning!!! Delicious!!

I love this recipe! I've been making it for about 10 years. It's a tradition in my house to have it every Thanksgiving, Christmas and Easter. It's so easy to make too! I do not add anything to the top after it's baked. My kids don't like nuts or fruits on it but I'm sure it would be delicious as well!
I followed it to a tee. Turned out nasty and soggy. Maybe the recipe should reflect some changes other people have suggested.
I've made this several time now and it's always a hit. I put chopped pecans on half and it gives it a little extra pop! I do use less milk than stated.
Love this recipe. I do also include 2 less eggs, 1/2 cup milk instead of 1 cup, 2 cups half and half instead of 1 - 1/2 cups.
Yummy!! I used 6 eggs and 1 cup each of milk and half n half! It took closer to an hour to bake! Everyone loved it!

I've had a recipe similar to this my mom made for years. I looked up a recipe to make for my grandkids in Houston .... I found this and looked similar. It had more milk than my moms, and definitely needed to to baked partial time covered as to not get to dark and crispy. I too added cinnamon and used 1/2&1/2, I added 3 Tbl of 1/2&1/2 to the caramel mixture as well. Otherwise the family loved it!!

Horrible! This recipe is easy to make but not edible when it's finished. It was soggy AND burned (how that's possible, I'm not sure) I tried to salvage it by cooking it through on the stove top and what I got was a sticky, undercooked, burned-sugar, smoky mess. What a complete waste of time and energy! I would not recommend this, even with the fixes suggested in other reviews. I ended up making pancakes after spending at least 2 hours trying to make my family Sunday morning breakfast. I would recommend Eggo waffles over this recipe.

I'm giving 4 stars because I did follow a lot of suggestions of other reviewers, especially since many complained of sogginess. I used just 6 eggs, just 1 1/4 cups milk, just 2 Tbslp. corn syrup, increased cinnamon to 1/2 tsp. , and added 1/2 tsp. nutmeg. I also did turn the bread slices over after a couple hours per reviewers' suggestion. I made 2 for a bridal shower. One as above and the other I added chopped pecans to the sauce before pouring over bread/egg mixture. The one with the pecans went first....bigger hit so I will likely always add the pecans. REALLY good!

Everybody always loves this French toast. I have made it exactly as the recipe calls... and I have made it and changed a few things .... and it always comes out delicious. I sometimes cover the top with blue berries.....I sometimes use maple syrup instead of corn syrup....This is always a hit!! I cover with foil for the first 20 minutes then uncover for the remaining 20. Love this Dish!

I've been making this recipe exactly how it says for years and I'm always asked for the recipe. I've used raisin bread or plain old white bread with the same delicious results. I'm begged to bring this to our annual pot luck brunch each year - I bring a full tray and it's the 1st thing to go. Definitely a holiday staple!
I would not bake it as long as it recommends. French bread burns quickly. Or maybe bake at a lower temp.
So good!! I didn‚Äôt have half & half, heavy cream, or corn syrup, so I had to make mine without those ingredients. But the bake still came out super yummy!! All my kids loved it.

After reading many reviews, I also tweaked the recipe: 6 eggs, 1 cup half & half + 1 cup 2% milk, 2 tsp. vanilla, 1 tsp. cinnamon. My pan held only half a loaf, so I reduced the butter & brown sugar substantially: 1/4 cup butter, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1 tsp. vanilla, 1 Tbl. corn syrup. It was the perfect amount of sweetness! It was a tad soggy after coming out , but after sitting for 15-20 minutes, it was much better. Thanks for the recipe!
Came out yummy!!

LOVED This recipe.
The only change I made was the bread. I used day old challah bread.
It came out well. My children, picky eaters, loved it and asked for me to make it again.

I‚Äôve made this dish so many times and everyone loves it. From the beginning I‚Äôve made it like some of the reviews have stated...6 eggs and 2 cups half and half for the liquid ingredients. I would suggest cooking it 10 to 15 minutes longer too...the bread gets these crusty edges that are just magic.
I added crushed walnuts. So good!!!!!!

This is so delicious. I used all half and half in place of the milk. It‚Äôs so good you could serve it as dessert. It tastes like a cross between creme br√ªl√©e and bread pudding. Definitely will make again.
This was very tasty and easy!
I will make it again but add raisins and double vanilla. I used maple syrup rather than the corn syrup with more sugar and butter. Bread really soaks up the egg mixture!

I used 6 eggs and 1 cup heavy cream and 1 cup milk(just because that is what I had...may try with just milk next time). I cut outs 1 to 2 tablespoons of butter too. ?? I covered it for the first 20 minutes in the oven and uncovered it for the last 20 minutes. ?

This recipe as written is a Zero star. Read the reviews and you will be able to make something you can eat. It is a shame to even have it listed because a lot of people will fail because they don't read the reviews. Mine was a success only because of the reviews but as written it is a total failure.
So amazing and easy. Had it baking while we we opening presents!
I have made this for Christmas breakfast for years. I always used a french baguette and make sure it is a day old. It turns out perfect every time. Great recipe!

I THOUGHT THE LIQUID WAS TOO MUCH, BUT MADE IT LAST NIGHT BEFORE BED, THEN WENT TO BED. I SERVED IT TO GUESTS THE NEXT MORNING-TOO SOGGY! I FINALLY LOOKED AT THE RATINGS AND LOTS OF PEOPLE SAID IT WAS TOO MUCH MILK. YOU SHOULDN‚ÄôT HAVE TO READ REVIEWS BEFORE MAKING A RECIPE. THIS MADE ME SO MAD.
I‚Äôve made this twice and can‚Äôt even get to take a picture my family attacks it to the point they burn their mouth eating it. This is so delightful!

I loved this recipe and all of my 15 guests did too!!
I added pecans on top which added nice texture and great flavor. The only change I will make next time is to cut the bread slices a bit thinner. The recipe says 1 in slices and I may have gone closer to 1 and 1/2. Wonderful recipe!
Delicious!!
I made it and followed the recipe exactly....it was perfect just like the recipe says. I wouldn‚Äôt change a thing!
turned out GREAT!

I forgot the French bread, so I used some sliced sour dough and oat nut that I had on hand. Because of this I had to cut back on the half and half so it wouldn be soggy. It was super good and kids loved it! Thx for a new fave!
Followed recipe no exceptions...it turned out Fantastic
Excellent and my husband loved it. I only made half the batch, spread in a 9x13 pan. Also accidently poured ALL the ingredients together instead of topping with the sugar mixture. Still great.

I used to make this recipe once a week! It's always a hit, but DO NOT alter the recipe. Follow it to the letter if you want it to turn out the best it can be. Yes, it all fits in the pan. Yes, you need all the liquid. If it turned out too soggy, you didnt follow the directions. Have fun cooking everyone!

This is one of my favorite brunch dishes to make for a buffet crowd, and I‚Äôve made it about a dozen times over the past several years. As usual for me though, I made a few minor changes........I use white/oat/cinnamon/and or raisin bread cut into cubes that I leave uncovered a few hours to become ‚Äústale‚Äù rather than French bread, because the French bread is a bit too chewy for some of my family. I cube it because I cut and serve this in squares rather than whole piece servings. I cut the melted butter back to about 6 T. because it doesn‚Äôt all get absorbed by the sugar and is too greasy, in my opinion. 
Remember to use a foil lined pan beneath casserole while baking, in case the topping bubbles over. If you halve the recipe, it fits nicely in a loaf pan. Written as is, it‚Äôs still a five star recipe and tastier than others I‚Äôve experimented with.

I followed others advise to toast the thickly cut bread slices, etc... I did not use the sauce as family/friends have different tastes (some love/hate maple syrup/honey/sugary anything). 
So I set up a "French Toast Bar" with butter/syrups/jams/honey/whipped cream/nuts and let everyone make it to taste. This is now a Brunch Classic!!

The only thing I did was cut the bread and leave it out to get a little firm before going to Easter Vigil. Maybe that's why so many complaints about soggy middles. All raves at this Easter Sunday brunch.
Wayyyyy too much liquid. It never absorbed it. I had to dump out liquid before I baked. Just like other reviewers I changed up the quantity of liquid I used next time I made it.

I agree with one reviewer, you shouldn't have to look at the reviews to better the recipe. This recipe taste delicious but it's way too soggy and too much liquid. I had to place it in the oven for double the time and it still was soggy in the middle.
Everyone loved it.

I love this recipe exactly how it is, however my husband thinks it is "slimy" in the middle, so I made a few tweaks. I only used 6 eggs instead of 8 and I also used Dunkin' Donuts coffee creamer in lieu of the 1/2 and 1/2; OMG AMAZING!!! I also took some above advice and baked it uncovered for 30 minutes without the topping, and then added the topping and baked for an additional 30 minutes. If you don't like it "soggy" drain the excess egg and milk mixture off after you turn the bread and let it set out waiting for the oven to preheat.
I also added raisins to the topping mix a few times when I felt like having raisins in it; delicious!

3 stars as written - I could see how this would be too moist with 3.5 cups of liquid. I did 6 eggs and 2 cups of half and half, as some of the reviews suggested. In the morning some of the pieces of bread still looked too dry, so I did 2 more eggs plus another half cup of half and half. Also used a bit of almond extract in addition to the vanilla. 

It turned out great!

I followed the recipe except I added the syrup 1/2 way thru the baking. Half the syrup would have been sufficient. As others said, the recipe as written is too sweet and too soggy. I‚Äôve made bread pudding before - this is soggier than bread pudding. The sweetness of the syrup overpowered the taste of the bread. I won‚Äôt be making this one again.

Put a pan under it!!! Took a shower while it baked and came out to find it had bubbled out all over my oven. Sticky, sugar mess stuck all over burning. Awful. Then I pull it out and it‚Äôs total mush. I have 1/3 out and out in another dish to keep baking. I hope it works. Looks like I will be cleaning my oven today.

Love this recipe! I used 2 cups eggnog and 1/2 cup of milk. While soaking in refrigerator, 2 hours in I turned slices over and let sit in refrigerator overnight. When baking, halfway through bake time I turned slices and then continued baking process. Absolutely a big hit! This is definitely a keeper!
This was a delicious dish!!! Instead of using brown sugar and syrup the recipe calls for, I used coconut sugar and added french brandy! DELISH!
I took cream cheese and mixed it with vanilla and sugar and added that on top with fresh blueberries

Yummm!
I substituted maple syrup for the light corn syrup.
Everyone thought that it was great!

I followed the advice of the other reviewers for this recipe and it was still awful. The flavor was okay although nothing to write home about. The texture is what sent this entire casserole to the garbage can. It was so mushy and gelatinous that I could barely swallow my first bite. Ugh. What a huge waste of time and I had nothing to serve my guests for breakfast.
I have made this several times. Perfect every time. I also use a little extra vanilla and cinnamon.

I have been making it for years and it is absolutely delicious. The only adjustment I have made is how I prepare the bread. I take packaged hero rolls (you can get them in the bread aisle) and I cube them. They soak up the liquid perfectly.

My entire family loves this dish and it is yummy.
This is a great way to make a crowd pleasing breakfast addition. You could add raisins or pecans, but this one is hard to beat and gets rave reviews every time.

This was good. Way to much liquid. Eliminating the milk or using 2 cups of a milk/ half & half mixture is plenty for this dish. The bread is to soggy using all of that liquid causing the sauce to just burn to the bottom of the pan. Next time I am going to use 2 cups of liquid (1 c milk & 1 c heavy cream) and add the sauce on during the last 10-15 minutes or just sprinkle the bread with cinnamon and brown sugar mixture. GREAT method for cooking French toast for a crowd.

I made this recipe years ago and found it on all recipes. From my notes, I used 6 eggs, probably why I didn't have to reduce the milk. 3-1/2 cups milk a mix of non-fat and whole. I also reduced butter to 1/2 cup, brown sugar to 1 cup. Used day old bread. I think I did flip the bread prior to adding sauce, like someone else recommended. Making it again for Mother's Day.
I followed the directions and this turned out terrible! Soggy disaster. It‚Äôs inedible. I shouldn‚Äôt have to follow reviews. This recipe as is gets zero stars from me.
Excellent !!! I used the changes from mom2many and it came out incredible. Everyone raved about it, just disappointed there were no leftovers

I made this for breakfast Christmas morning with a couple of substitutions. I decreased the eggs to 6 -like the one reviewer said so it wasn‚Äôt mushy- extra cinnamon and thick slices of challah bread. It was AAAHHHHHMAAAZING! Everyone could not stop eating it! Thinking of giving trays of this out to family when we host Christmas Eve for their Christmas morning breakfast.
I used 7 eggs, 1 c Milk 1c 1/2 and 1/2, I thought parts were still a little soggy may use less milk next time. Loved by my guests

I made this many times. I always followed the suggestions of not adding milk and using two cups of half & half. I also used 5 eggs and 3/4 cup of brown sugar! This is my favorite breakfast treat and it taste even better the next day.
Followed the tweaks in the reviews and it was outstanding!!
SO GOOD!!! Super fluffy and delicious!

It was so easy to put together. Fixed it while camping with family. It was a hit. Everyone enjoyed it. The only thing I would do differently would be to spray the pan with Pam prior to melting the butter. It was a bit sticky at the bottom.
This was absolutely delicious! Very rich and special. I did decrease the liquid as suggested by many. Fabulous!
This dish is amazing! I've been asked to make it again and again.

I've made it for brunch and even as dessert and it's always a hit! If I'm using fresh bread, I lightly toast the slices for a couple of minutes in the oven first. It is quite sweet on its own so to freshen it up I serve it with assorted berries and plain yoghurt
Perfect as written. My family loves this recipe, it is always requested at overnight gatherings. I flip the bread before putting it in the oven. Not sure if it makes a difference or not.

I used my homemade whole spelt flour, which has a tendency to be a bit crumbly and this recipe worked fabulous! I only made 3/4 of an milk&egg mix to let the bread soak in over night and added 1/4 of it with butter before baking since it seemed a bit dry. Next time I'll make it according to instructions ;-). Great recipe!
Family loved it and will definitely make it again!

This was excellent and I got raves from our guests. Used 7 eggs, 1 cup milk and 1 cup half and half. Flipped the bread over once while soaking, and once while baking and then added the topping. Took about an hour to bake. Thank you Antlala for the recipe!
Super easy and delicious! Family asked if it could be a new Christmas morning tradition. :)

Like many others, I adapted this to meet my smaller family needs. But I kept the recipe as written, with a few minor changes. No half-and-half, but I used whole milk and added cinnamon to the caramel sauce on top. I like a quick morning breakfast like this, and probably will let the bread and egg mixture sit in the fridge overnight, but this first time, I let it sit about 15 minutes and it turned out great!! I particularly like the sauce on top, as it didn't need anything else but some fresh fruit to go with it.

This was sooooooo good!!! I read the reviews and did what most others had done - used half the amount of milk. I used 2 cups of half and half TOTAL and no other liquid and it came out perfect. I also omitted the corn syrup. I also topped it with a ton of pecans before baking. So delicious. 
My boyfriend and I ate this for Christmas morning breakfast and couldn't get over how good it was and how it was not overly sweet at all. Just perfect. Definitely halve the milk/cream. I can imagine it'd be a soggy mess if I used what the recipe said.
Made it exactly as your recipe states. Everybody loved it. Excellent
It was delicious. Added pecans halfway into baking, and followed a suggestion to bake 20 min. covered and 20 min uncovered. Yummy!

This recipe turned Christmas breakfast into a sloppy mess. If you've made this leaving out half the liquid, YOU DID NOT MAKE THIS RECIPE. You should not be rating this 5 stars if you have to alter it that much to make it work.

This was so good, my family loved it! The best part is the crust formed from the brown sugar mix . So if you don't like soggy french toast make sure to lay the bread down flat (1 loaf squeezed into a 9x13 pan) so the crust can go all over the bread. This is a keeper for Christmas morning!

I make this recipe all the time but make the following changes. I use only 6 or 7 eggs, 3/4 cup half and half and about 1 cup milk. I also use real maple syrup instead of corn syrup. I also flip the bread before heading to bed. Cook half the time without the sauce then add the sauce and cook the rest of the time.

We make it just as the recipe states; we own a restaurant and after LOVING this one Christmas morning, we offer it every Mother's Day as a special topped with fresh berries and it's a huge hit. We've had it at home every Christmas since and in fact, I'm making it right now!

The only change I made to the recipe was that I cut the bread in cubes instead of slices and while the oven was heating up I stirred the bread and egg just to ensure that the bread soaked up everything. My family and co-workers love this dish!
Made this today for a breakfast meeting for our pastor - followed directions as written. Only change was to cut the bread into cubes. Everyone loved it!
This is my go to brunch dish. I omit the half and half, but use Almond Milk instead and slice a banana on top. It is always raved about.
This is my favorite breakfast treat. No changes need to be made to the recipe. My husband and I love it!
The bread was very soggy , there was way to much egg in it, and it was too sweet.

When this is baking it really puffs up, and the sugary sauce spills over the edges. A regular 9x13x2" pyrex pan is NOT deep enough. Next time I'm going to have to use a deep foil pan.... UPDATE: 1 14-oz loaf of Vanilla Cream Brioche Bread; cut into 11 slices; 7 eggs; 1/3 cup half & half; 1-2/3 cup milk. Add syrup for last 15 minutes of cooking after popping bubbles in the bread. Next time : 6 eggs & a little less liquid.

Excellent! As close as I've come to the toast at the French cafe in my 'hood. I did not alter the custard proportions, but did change the topping by replacing the corn for maple syrup. I also used challa bread that was dehydrated a bit by placing it in the oven at a very low temp. 
I've made this twice. The first batch I cut the egg by one and deacreased the liquid by 3/4. This batch was delicious but more the style of stove top French toast. The second, I followed the recipe as posted and find it more custard-like. My family prefers the recipe in its original proportions as well. Also, I would suggest very thick slices of a dense bread.

I didn't have French bread, so I used a loaf of generic soft whole wheat bread. I subbed evaporated milk for the half & half, and used real maple syrup instead of corn syrup. I didn't change the egg/milk quantities as others did, but it baked beautifully. Everyone who ate a piece loved it and wanted the recipe.

This recipe is a keeper! I didn't have any half and half, so I used 2 cups whole milk. I also wanted more of a casserole, so I broke up the break into pieces. Make sure you use a glass pan, because it takes some elbow grease to clean out all the sticky, but it is worth it!!!

First off I had to scramble and use wheat bread instead of French bread but that didn't change this from being more custard & bread pudding like than French Toast. The Caramel Sauce really seemed to overwhelm the dish and could have used maybe a maple flavoring.
Followed the reciepe and it was amazing!!!!

I thought this was just OK, I always read most recent reviews, so did the 2 cups half n half, 6 eggs, etc. You really have to watch this toward end of baking, easily burns and sauce turns into hard candy. Will keep looking for that perfect recipe.

1st time making a baked french toast, though I did change it a little. I used 16 eggs, 3 cups of half & half (no milk) 1/2 tsp of cinnamon, 3 tsp of vanilla and 1 lb of Italian bread (it came sliced, so I cut the slices diagonally in about 1" pieces and stuffed them into the pan). I followed the directions otherwise. I also left it in the oven and turned the heat off and let it sit another 20 minutes. For the topping I used 2 cups of brown sugar, 2 sticks of butter and 3 or 4 tbs of dark corn syrup ( I had it already). This came out awesome! Topped it with strawberries cup up with sugar mixed in for the juices. No extra syrup was needed and all the kids loved it. One of the kids called it cake. So good!
